title: Core UI Components & Design System
description: Build reusable UI components with neo-brutalist dark aesthetic, implement responsive layouts, create accessible navigation, and establish animation system with motion preferences support.

stories.title: Build responsive header with navigation
acceptance_criteria: Header component with site logo/name and navigation links
Responsive: hamburger menu on mobile, horizontal nav on desktop
Active route highlighting with Next.js usePathname
Keyboard navigable with proper focus management
Sticky header with smooth scroll behavior
stories.apl_goal: Create responsive Header component with accessible navigation, mobile hamburger menu, active link highlighting, and sticky positioning with neo-brutalist styling
technical_notes: Use next/link for client-side navigation
Implement mobile menu with focus trap when open
Add aria-current='page' for active links

stories.title: Create footer with social links and contact
acceptance_criteria: Footer component with copyright, social links, and mailto contact
Social icons accessible with proper aria-labels
External links open in new tab with rel='noopener noreferrer'
Responsive layout: stacked on mobile, multi-column on desktop
GitHub icon links to @daksmitty profile
stories.apl_goal: Build Footer component with social links (GitHub, Twitter/X, etc.), mailto contact link, responsive layout, and ensure all links are accessible with proper ARIA labels
technical_notes: Use lucide-react or react-icons for social icons
Mailto link format: mailto:dakota@example.com
Add visual indicator for external links

stories.title: Implement main layout wrapper with SEO meta tags
acceptance_criteria: RootLayout component wrapping all pages with Header and Footer
Default meta tags (title, description, viewport, charset)
OpenGraph meta tags for social sharing
Favicon and apple-touch-icon configured
HTML lang attribute set to 'en'
stories.apl_goal: Create RootLayout component with Header and Footer, configure default meta tags in app/layout.tsx, set up OpenGraph metadata, and add favicon assets
technical_notes: Use Next.js Metadata API (export metadata object)
Create reusable generateMetadata function for dynamic pages
Ensure viewport meta for mobile responsiveness

stories.title: Create Button component with brutalist styling
acceptance_criteria: Button component with variants (primary, secondary, ghost)
Hard shadows and thick borders for brutalist aesthetic
Hover and focus states with accessible contrast
Support for icon + text combinations
Disabled state with reduced opacity
stories.apl_goal: Build accessible Button component with neo-brutalist styling (hard shadows, thick borders), multiple variants, keyboard focus states, and icon support
technical_notes: Use class-variance-authority (cva) for variant management
Ensure focus ring is visible and high-contrast
Add transform on hover for depth effect

stories.title: Build Card component for post previews
acceptance_criteria: Card component with thumbnail image, title, excerpt, and metadata
Brutalist borders and shadow treatment
Hover effect with smooth transition (respecting motion preferences)
Responsive: full-width mobile, grid layout desktop
Semantic HTML (article, h2, time elements)
stories.apl_goal: Create Card component for blog post previews with neo-brutalist styling, responsive image handling, hover animations that respect prefers-reduced-motion, and semantic HTML structure
technical_notes: Use next/image for optimized thumbnails
Aspect ratio: 16:9 for thumbnails
Add reading time and publish date metadata

stories.title: Implement Tag component with filtering link
acceptance_criteria: Tag component styled as brutalist pill/badge
Links to filtered view of posts by tag
Hover state with color transition
Accessible with proper contrast ratios
Supports both interactive (link) and static modes
stories.apl_goal: Build Tag component with neo-brutalist pill styling, create link variant that filters posts by tag, and ensure WCAG AA contrast compliance
technical_notes: Tag links format: /blog/tags/[tag-slug]
Use URL-safe slugification for tag links
Add aria-label for tag filter links

stories.title: Install Framer Motion with accessibility configuration
acceptance_criteria: Framer Motion installed and configured
Global motion configuration respects prefers-reduced-motion
Utility hook useReducedMotion() created
Animation variants defined for common patterns (fade, slide, scale)
Test component demonstrates motion preference detection
stories.apl_goal: Install Framer Motion, create global MotionConfig with prefers-reduced-motion support, build useReducedMotion hook, and define reusable animation variants
technical_notes: Use MotionConfig to set global reducedMotion preference
Create variants that fallback to instant transitions when motion reduced
Test with browser DevTools media query emulation

stories.title: Add page transition and scroll animations
acceptance_criteria: Page transitions with fade effect (or instant if motion reduced)
Scroll-triggered animations for post cards (stagger effect)
IntersectionObserver-based lazy animation triggers
Smooth scroll behavior for anchor links
All animations have instant fallbacks for reduced motion
stories.apl_goal: Implement page transition animations, create scroll-triggered animations for blog cards using IntersectionObserver, and ensure all animations gracefully degrade for users with prefers-reduced-motion
technical_notes: Use framer-motion's AnimatePresence for page transitions
Stagger children animations for card grids
CSS scroll-behavior: smooth with @media (prefers-reduced-motion) override

architectural_decisions: Component library built in-house (no Shadcn/UI to maintain design uniqueness)
Framer Motion for animations with mandatory reduced-motion support
Tailwind CSS with custom utilities for brutalist shadows and borders
Semantic HTML for accessibility and SEO
Class Variance Authority (CVA) for component variant management

verification_requirements.pencil_check: All UI components must be visually verified against Pencil canvas designs. Verify neo-brutalist styling (thick 2-4px borders, hard shadows, #0A0A0A background, #F5F5F5 text, Space Grotesk font) is correctly applied.
verification_requirements.acceptance_criteria_addition: Visual design verified against Pencil canvas selections
